title: ClientCenterClient
description: This schema defines te Client center client entities.

name.description: Name that identifies the source of an external Client center client. Example `HealthCare.gov`.

endpoint.description: Name that identifies the source of an external Client center client. Example `HealthCare.gov`.

id.description: Unique identifier of a Client center client instance.

name.description: Preferred name for the Client center client.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this glossary.

description.description: Description of the Client center client.

fullyQualifiedName.description: A unique name that identifies a Client center client. It captures name hierarchy of glossary of clients in the form of `glossaryName.parentclient.childclient`.

synonyms.description: Alternate names that are synonyms or near-synonyms for the Client center client.

clientCenter.description: Client center that this client belongs to.

parent.description: Parent Client center client that this client is child of. When `null` this client is the root client of the glossary.

children.description: Other Client center clients that are children of this Client center client.

relatedClients.description: Other Client center clients that are related to this Client center client.

references.description: Link to a reference from an external Client Center.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to this entity.

reviewers.description: User names of the reviewers for this glossary.

owner.description: Owner of this Client center client.

usageCount.description: Count of how many times this and it's children Client center clients are used as labels.

tags.description: Tags associated with this Client center client. These tags captures relationship of a Client center client with a tag automatically. As an example a Client center client 'User.PhoneNumber' might have an associated tag 'PII.Sensitive'. When 'User.Address' is used to label a column in a table, 'PII.Sensitive' label is also applied automatically due to Associated tag relationship.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

status.description: Status of the Client center client.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.

disabled.description: System glossary can't be deleted. Use this flag to disable them.

mutuallyExclusive.description: Client center clients that are children of this client are mutually exclusive. When mutually exclusive is `true` only one client can be used to label an entity from this group. When mutually exclusive is `false`, multiple clients from this group can be used to label an entity.

extension.description: Entity extension data with custom attributes added to the entity.

domain.description: Domain the Client center client belongs to. When not set, the Glossary TErm inherits the domain from the Client center it belongs to.
